Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from three fragments) of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery plate or stemmed dish; interior slipped white: worn decoration; maeander and square frieze on top of flat rim; at junction of rim and floor band in added red on top of black band; on outer floor, lotus flower and bud frieze with added red set on black band with added red and white lines; to centre, worn undetermined decorative pattern in black with added red, perhaps geese/swans; edge and underside of rim painted; on underside two sets of three orange-brown fired bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Two of the three sherds are numbered: NA64a and NA64b.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.868)
